page.title: 13Shiskine Churches
page.content: There are two churches in Shiskine, St.Molio's Church of Scotland and The Free Church of Scotland. Most of the people in the valley go to one or other of the churches. St.Molio's is a listed building 96 yrs old, being designed by a famous architect called Sir John James Burnet Another to the same plan was built in Perthshire. The minister serves Pirnmill and Lochranza as well. In this Church they stand to sing to the music of an electric Compton organ, and sit to pray. The Free Church building is 28 years old, and the minister serves the whole of the island. In this Church the congregation sit to sing the psalms, led by a precentor, and stand to pray. The ministers are joint school chaplains, taking a service on alternate Fridays.
